value.title: OVERLAPPING Power BI visuals can be FRUSTRATING!?! How to avoid?
value.excerpt: Overlapping Power BI visuals can be FRUSTRATING! Adam dives in to show you some tinkering to possibly avoid the situation.  Download Sample: https://guyinacu.be/overlapsample  üì¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level?

value.title: Parameters and Templates with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows a way you can use parameters and templates, with Power BI Desktop, to provide prompts for your connection's server and database properties.   This is great for when you are creating a report, and need to share it with a customer that may have a different name for the server

images.title: Parameters and Templates with Power BI Desktop

value.title: Power BI Admin Roles and the Admin Portal
value.excerpt: Adam looks at the Power BI Admin Portal and the roles you need to be able to access and manage your Power BI items. This consists of two potential roles within Azure Active Directory or Office 365.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba

value.title: Power BI for the NON-TECHnical person
value.excerpt: Is Power BI intimidating? Coming from Microsoft Excel? You consider yourself non-technical? Don't want to have to write or know anything about DAX? Patrick looks at how you can create a report quickly with just your Excel data and not have to write any code!  üì¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Data source, Dataset and parameters
value.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Patrick walks you through how to get started with a paginated report using Report Builder. In this video, he starts off with how to create an embedded data source, a dataset, and parameters.  To download Report Builder, check out this link: https://guyinacu.be/reportbuilder

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: 4 Ways To Get Data
value.excerpt: In this Power BI tutorial, Adam looks at 4 ways to get data in Power BI. This focuses on Power BI Desktop and the main storage modes - Import, DirectQuery and Live Connections to Analysis Services. If you are new to Power BI, be sure to check out this Power BI Tutorial: 4 ways to get data.   Import (Excel)

value.title: Use Power BI Web From Example over multiple URLs
value.excerpt: Wil Reynolds asked an awesome question about how to use multiple URLs with the web from example Power BI feature. The magic is with Power Query functions and parameters. Patrick has you covered!  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba

value.title: Using Images from a Database in Power BI
value.excerpt: We've looked at images from sources like OneDrive and the web with your Power BI reports. What about from a database? Is that possible? Patrick takes a look at how you can do it.  SQLJason Blog:  http://sqljason.com/2018/01/embedding-images-in-power-bi-using-base64.html  Gerhard's Blog: https://blog.gbrueckl.at/2018/01/storing-images-powerbi-analysis-services-data-models/

value.title: Using Power BI reports from an end user perspective (2021)

value.title: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 data‚Äã
value.excerpt: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 Data‚Äã

value.title: Create¬†paginated reports¬†¬†
value.excerpt: Paginated reports allow report developers to create Power BI artifacts that have tightly controlled rendering requirements. Paginated reports are ideal for creating sales invoices, receipts, purchase orders, and tabular data. This module will teach you how to create reports, add parameters, and work with tables and charts in paginated reports.

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: #2 DAX Fridays! 101: Introduction to filter and row context
value.excerpt: Are you new to DAX and want to learn what those things called filter context and row context are? I will attempt to do just that in today's video.
